Question, have a dataset in the following format:
`x1 y1 z1 yaw1 pitch1 attackTypeOrdinal, x2 y2 z2 yaw2 pitch2 attackTypeOrdinal`

Here is an example of the layout:
`1 2 3 4 5 3, 1 2 3 4 5 3`

What I was planning on doing is having separated lists of those pairs in order for the machine to find patterns off of, what is the best way to do this?

PS: The attackTypeOrdinal is the same for the entire pair
@camdenorrb  you need to design a lost function accordingly.
lost function?
Also it might be good to note that I plan to train this on the fly, rather than having set values in a file
Oh, Loss Function?
you can do this on the fly as long as you put them into a DataSetIterator,
but if the training data change, you will need to retrain your model
so the best thing to do is getting the training data ready before you start this process
That won't be possible, in this case
It will need to be improved with the more information we give it
.....normally you can wait until you get enough "on the fly" data
Yes, we can wait for one input, but we can't wait for all inputs
Would I still need to retrain the entire model each time?
I think you get the idea wrong.
Hm?
you have assume that the pattern doesn't change, so that you can train a network and then apply it on the other data.
in this case, you need to wait and get a training set first
Yeah we can wait for individual training sets
But we can't provide them all at once
once you happy with the result, you can then use the model on other data
so you expect the machine learn the pattern based on one date?
No, I expect it to be able to learn on different dates
It won't get it down the first time we give it a training set
so you need to get these different dates first before it can learn
It will take a-lot more
Also since I'm taking 2, 6 parameter inputs how can I link 2 loss functions?
Or "classify" it
you try to get the patterns between these two inputs right?
Alright, let me explain
So basically I will take in around 100 pairs of those 2 inputs in each training session and the goal is to find the pattern in a 10 pair input
The pair references each other
This data will be used to classify what type of pattern it is, which will be trained
I'm not sure if this is the best way to do it or if it's even possible
Does it make sense?
what types of pattern you expect to get from this task? could you give me an example?
So in this case it's to classify if a player is a hacker or not
I see
It has to determine it quickly, hence the 10 input idea
It will be trained with a ton of datasets tho
I think this is a classic Anomaly Detection problem
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=g2YBWQnqOpw
this might help
I guess, but the attackType kinda makes it different
yes
go through that video, you will find it's helpful
Alrighty :3
there are 3 videos in fact, you can get them from https://www.coursera.org/learn/machine-learning/home/week/9
it's free, go through the whole week9 if you have time

`Format: abs(x2 - x1) abs(y2 - y1) abs(z2 - z1) abs(yaw2 - yaw1) abs(pitch2 - pitch1) attackTypeOrdinal`

Could you suggest some dropout?
When I set dropout to 0 it means it is not performing dropout?
yes
0.0 means - no dropout
same for dropconnect
0.5 could be good for start?
that depends
@papperwing https://github.com/deeplearning4j/deeplearning4j/blob/master/deeplearning4j-nn/src/main/java/org/deeplearning4j/nn/conf/NeuralNetConfiguration.java#L962-L972
0.5 is usually the place to start, and is what tends to be used most commonly in practice
One more question. When I set dropout for whole network (for example from zoo) will it change dropout setting for layers which has already dropout set?
I set it in FineTuneConfiguration
anything set after .list() or .graphBuilder() will override the global (pre list/graphBuilder) setting
same as with fine tune - or at least it should be
i.e., finetune is global, but override on specific layers if you want
Remember dl4j wants an inverted dropout value.
So if you want 40% dropout you need to give it 0.6
(Its the probability of _retaining_ an activation, not the probability of dropping it)
Cool thanks :D I thought it is exactly opposit :D
0.5 is save than :D
Yes exactly, I was a bit confused by it as well.
With 0.5 it makes no difference, but once you deviate from that it makes a huge diff.

nope
we do whatever we can for backward compatibility

That's great. Are there any significant differences between LSTM and GravesLSTM? I've built a system with a few models (and a "voting" system) to classify text data, I'm wondering if including an extra classifier based on LSTM makes any sense. If they are both expected to work well on similar data, I'm not sure if there's a reason to do so.

My RNN classifier configuration is based on [this](https://github.com/deeplearning4j/dl4j-examples/blob/master/dl4j-examples/src/main/java/org/deeplearning4j/examples/recurrent/word2vecsentiment/Word2VecSentimentRNN.java#L74-L85).

I'd bet the answer is "it depends". : P I guess what I'm asking is - should I expect any significant differences between two models built with LSTM and GravesLSTM layers using similar hyperparameters? Or will the differences be no more significant than between two models with GravesLSTM layers built with different seeds?
I think the plain LSTM is significantly faster to train on GPU.
I see. Is the training performance the only significant difference or are there different use cases for these layers?
I think our GravesLSTM uses peep connections? I think it can perform better with the same amount of training iterations.
@wmeddie So basically you're trading training speed on GPU for the need to feed more data or use more epochs, but the overall performance should be roughly the same?

To be honest - I was wondering if there are any theoretical differences, like one being easier to overfit than the other, to see if there is a reason to include another RNN classifier in my project. I guess I'll just try using LSTM and check the results in practice.

@czyzby re: LSTM vs. GravesLSTM - they are similar, latter has peephole connections. See javadoc for more details
I'd recommend using the first - it supports cudnn, the latter doesn't (just need to add deeplearning4j-cuda-8.0 to your project to use it) - both were added post 0.8.0 fyi

@webegit1234 it depends on what you want to do. If you simply want to make a prediction, at each time step, based on a complete time series, just use .output
rnnTimeStep is only necessary if you don't have the complete time series available when generating predictions
and hence want to make predictions 1 or N steps at a time, taking into account the past history/state
read this, if you haven't already: https://deeplearning4j.org/usingrnns#rnntimestep
@AlexDBlack To best explain what I'm trying to do, say I'm trying to predict the stock market and I trained with 30 time steps of past data. I want to be able to predict the next 30 days.

in that case, it depends on your network configuration
one approach (and, the one that I would probably recommend) is to use a multi-task network: that is, at each step, predict T+1, T+2, ..., T+30

you can potentially generate predictions and feed them back in *as if they were real inputs* - but that will likely perform less well, especially for long time horizons for the predictions (also google beam search, if you consider this approach)

in the former case, you have 30 outputs, and use rnnTimeStep once for each new step of data. in the latter case, you have 1 output, and use rnnTimeStep 30 times for each new piece of data (being careful to reset back to the past state)
@AlexDBlack Thanks Alex. This is good info.

Greetings! Anyone have a Maven command to build dl4j on a Mac that excludes all the Cuda stuff? I cannot figure it out. :(

@timmolter 
Should be smth like this:
```
mvn -B -U clean install -pl '!deeplearning4j/deeplearning4j-cuda,!nd4j/nd4j-backends/nd4j-backend-impls/nd4j-cuda,!nd4j/nd4j-backends/nd4j-backend-impls/nd4j-cuda-platform,!deeplearning4j/deeplearning4j-cuda' -Dlibnd4j.platform=macosx-x86_64 -Djavacpp.platform=macosx-x86_64 -P native -Dmaven.test.skip=true
```
If you need mac without avx2...

If with avx2 then add
```
-Dlibnd4j.extension=avx2 -Djavacpp.extension=avx2
```
